value.title: Power BI Week Number (Weeknum) in Date Table #Q&A
value.excerpt: Week Numbers (Weeknum) in Power BI Date Table (Calendar Table) are extremely useful. value.title: What is Power BI Gateway? Do You Need it to Connect to On-Premise Data? Can You Avoid Using One?
value.excerpt: Power BI Gateway acts as a bridge to let PowerBI.com (Cloud) connect to your On-Premise (Local) Data Sources – like local Excel Files or a local SQL Server. value.title: Calculating Stock on Hand Using DAX   Power BI Inventory Model
value.excerpt: You don't have always the luxury of having a snapshot fact table that has the stock on hand value for every single day, at every single workshop, and for every single product. Even if you want to build such a table, it can get easily gigantic. In this video, I am going to show you how you can use DAX

value.title: Create a Table in Power BI using Enter Data and How to Edit it
value.excerpt: Sometimes you just need a new table with a few rows or columns to be added to your data model. One option to create that table is to use the Enter Data option in Power BI Desktop. In this article, I’ll explain how you can use it, and also; more important: How to edit the data of that table after creating

value.title: Get Data from Multiple Excel Files with Different Sheet Names into Power BI

In this video, I’ll explain a method you can use that works regardless of the sheet names. Download the sample files from my

value.title: How to Create a Date or Calendar Table and Dimension in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Date dimension or calendar table is one of the most important dimensions in any BI system. In this video, I'm showing you how easy is to create a date dimension using Power Query. The script of this video can be found in my blog article here:  https://radacad.com/create-a-date-dimension-in-power-bi-in-4-steps-step-1-calendar-columns

value.title: How to Use Time and Date Dimensions in a Power BI Model

value.title: Power BI One Slicer to filter other slicers based on Items that has value only without BI Direction

How you can find all the products that this customer purchased or all customers who have purchased this product using two separate slicers. value.title: Replace BLANK with Zero in Power BI Visuals Such as Card

If you want to replace that blank to zero, here is a trick for you. a very simple trick that you can use anywhere easily. Read more details in my blog post,

value.title: Row Filtering in Power BI and Power Query   Remove Blank Rows Vs Remove Empty
value.excerpt: When you have blank values in your data table, you can use Power Query transformations to remove the row with blank values. There are two transformations that are used very often for this purpose: Remove Empty and Remove blank rows. These two transformations are not exactly the same. In this article,

value.title: Search Bar in Power BI Slicer
value.excerpt: If you have too many items in a slicer, such as the list of customer names, or product names, then finding one amongst the list takes time, unless you enable the search.
